intro: Plesioneuron subterminale, commonly known as the terminal spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant features slender, grass-like stems and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense clusters at the tips of its stems. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense vegetation in suitable habitats. The plant plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
